text.p: - Denmark's Danfoss heating equipment maker will build a new plant, worth 50 million zlotys, in Grodzisk Mazowiecki, central Poland, which will employ 1,500 workers.
- Warsaw municipality is unlikely to issue municipal bonds and is interested in obtaining a longterm bank credit on good terms, the city treasurer Lucja Konopka said.
- Around 1,500 firms are exhibiting their products at the Poznan-based Spring Consumer Goods Fair'97 currently under way.

- Implemetation of the KRP Poludnie petrochemical sector development programme will increase Poland's chemical output value to 10.6 billion zlotys and exports to 4.2 billion zlotys by 2005, the economic ministers' committee (KERM) said.

- The state-owned Bank Gospodarki Zywnosciowej (BGZ) agricultural sector bank and Germany's Bausparkasse Schwabisch Hall construction and mortgage bank will create a joint venture for low-interest housing construction loans, if parliament passes laws in support of housing related savings, the two companies said.
- The Lublin-based Pierwszy Komercyjny Bank (PKB) will net 13 million zlotys in 1997, the bank's president Jan Rejent said.
- The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) wants to participate in the restructuring of the state-owned BGZ agricultural sector bank, EBRD's president Jacques de Larosiere said.

- Poland's Bumar Labedy heavy industry and armaments plant has not conducted any talks with Ukraine's heavy industry firms on co-production of T-80 tanks to be exported to Pakistan, the plant's board memeber Stanislaw Makosz said. Russia's Siegodnia daily accused Poland and Ukraine of plans to produce and export jointly made tanks.

- The Szczecin-based Pomorski Bank Kredytowy (PBKS) bank's net profit will reach 88 million zlotys on a gross profit of 140 million zlotys in 1997. Deposits will grow by 25 percent to 3.65 billion zlotys and credits accrual will grow by 27 percent to 1.9 48 billion zlotys, PBKS president Wlodzimierz Dabrowski said.

- Poland's Main Customs Office (GUC) will have to employ around 2,300 new customs officers on Poland's eastern border and invest 50 million zlotys in development to fulfil the requirements of the EU regulations, GUC's president Mieczyslaw Nogaj said.
- The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) plans to invest $250 million in Poland this year, EBRD president Jacques de Larosiere said.

- The listed Chemiskor leather firm will supply footwear leather to the Ariel footwear maker worth 2 million zlotys this year, which makes up 20 percent of the company's output, Chemiskor's president Jerzy Stepien said.
